dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it done, Papa?! Weli ma dhameyn miyaa Aabe?! (Welli mah dah-main meeyah Ah- be?!) MUSA MUSA (CONT’D) Patience, Alia... Dulgaado, Alia... (Dul-gaar-doh, Alia...) She fidgets with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you like the colors I Maka heshay kalarka aan used? isticmaalayo? (Maka heh-shay kalarka aan iss-tih-maa-la-yo?) The tubing has been decorated with bright twists of electrical tape that form rings of colorful patterns. MUSA MUSA (CONT’D) Very pretty... Aad iyo Aad La'Jacleey... (Aad iyo aad lah-gel-lay...)  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 2. Scattered around the yard are half a dozen discarded hoop different sizes and colors.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my best one ever! Kani waa midka aan weligeyga Jeelaandoono! (Kani waa midka aan weli-gay- ist-ti-male-donno! ) MUSA smiles, and hands her the hoop. ALIA takes it. She swings it over her body and around her waist - and SPINS She swings her hips, making the hoop swirl around her bod

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, Mama! Hooyo, Fiiri! (Hoy-yo Fee-ree!) FATIMA looks out into the yard at her and smiles. As ALIA continues to spin the hoop, the CAMERA RISES UP o her and continues to rise, higher and higher, until we ar seeing: A BIRD’S-EYE VIEW of the compound within the surrounding neighbourhood setting. Their home is in a Somali Militia controlled neighbourhoo Nairobi. The sun has just risen, but people are already o the move. Beyond the safety and privacy of the walled family compou militia hang out on street corners and guard unofficial checkpoint barriers on neighbourhood entrances, making it no-go area for the Kenyan police. Within this no-go area they stop cars and search anyone t suspect of being a Kenyan security police collaborator. Four YOUNG MEN drive past Alia’s compound in a pickup tru with a machine gun bolted on to the back. They set the neighbourhood tone. As we rise higher we reveal that the whole area is a rabb warren of streets, shops and market stalls. We FADE IN our TITLE:

dialogues.speaker: EYE IN THE SKY
dialogues.text: Over this we become faintly aware of the low pulse of dee bass music...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 3. INT. BEDROOM - POWELL’S HOUSE - SURREY - NIGHT 2 COLONEL KATHERINE POWELL lies awake in bed. Her husband S sleeps beside her in an eye mask. ON SCREEN: SURREY, ENGLAND - 03h15 The thud of music is coming from another room: Quiet, but loud enough to be irritating once one becomes aware of it POWELL has become aware of it and it is now irritating he She gets up. INT. LANDING - POWELL’S HOUSE - SURREY - NIGHT 3 POWELL, in her pyjamas, exits her bedroom, crosses the landing and stops at the bedroom from where the monotonou bass is emanating. She stands for a moment, wondering whether to enter the r She decides against it. EXT. ALIA’S COMPOUND - EASTLEIGH - DAWN 4 ALIA swings her hips as the hoop whizzes around her body. INT. KITCHEN - POWELL’S HOUSE - SURREY - NIGHT 5 POWELL, still in her pyjamas but now also in slippers and dressing gown, enters the kitchen. A Labrador dog, Jesse, gets up out of a basket. POWELL pats the dog’s head, goes to the kitchen tap and drinks some water. A routine. EXT. GARDEN - POWELL’S HOUSE - SURREY - NIGHT 6 POWELL, with Jesse following, exits the house. She walks across the garden to an office ‘shed’ and unlocks a bolte door. She goes inside. EXT. ALIA’S COMPOUND - EASTLEIGH - DAWN 7 ALIA, laughing, swings her hips. The hoop whizzes around  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 4. INT. POWELL’S GARDEN OFFICE - SURREY - NIGHT 8 POWELL withdraws a secure dongle from a pocket in her gow and plugs it into a USB port in a computer on a desk. Jesse knows the routine: he has a basket in here too and lies down in it. The office is full of military books, files, mementoes an photographs: her entire military career is in this room - we immediately understand that this is where she lives ou her life. The house is just where she sleeps. While her computer boots up, POWELL glances at a large pi board on a wall beside her desk: It is covered in hand-written notes and SURVEILLANCE PHOTOGRAPHS taken in various foreign locations of WANTED HVI's - High Value Individuals. The faces are mostly Somali, but we also notice a young British Muslim student named RASHEED HAMUD, and a young American named MUHAMMAD ABDISALAAM. (Note: It does not ma whether we know their nationality at this point, but thei dress is clearly western.) One photograph in particular stands out from the rest: A WHITE WOMAN wearing a deep blue head scarf (a hijab) wh covers her hair. The name SUSAN HELEN DANFORD appears ben the picture, as well as the name “AYESHA AL-HADY." Another picture shows Danford without her hijab. She’s an attractive woman in her early thirties. In yet another she is with a man named ABDULLAH AL-HADY - we will learn is her husband. Still other pictures of her show her in various foreign locations. A few copies of different PASSPORTS show her i with different names: ALLISON WEST, REBECCA SUTTON. Below the images of Danford and Al-Hady are dozens of oth YOUNG FACES - some Western dressed, some local Somali fighters with weapons. Some have been inked out in red. POWELL stares at the image of Danford for a moment. Then her computer BLEEPS and she turns to check her in-bo An email message comes up with A PICTURE OF A YOUNG ARMY CORPORAL in a wheelchair wearing PROSTHETIC LEGS. We read  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 5. Dear Colonel Powell The new legs are good. I can walk to the shops, but I don see the point in doing that, or in doing anything. Captain Kirby has suggested... She scrolls to the end: .-. to be honest, I wish I had died. Corporal Shane Allen. Powell sits staring blankly at the picture of the cripple soldier. She is, for a moment, lost. Then she begins to t a reply. Dear Corporal Allen Do not lose hope. Once you recover, I promise to assist i reassigning you... As she types, an INCOMING EMAIL ALERT pops up on her scre Subject: “More news on Ben.” Powell stops writing her reply to the first email. She hesitates, then opens the new one. We READ: This was posted an hour ago. http: //www.al-news.org/watch_now/ Still can't believe we lost him. Good luck this morning. Talk later. Frank POWELL steels herself. Then reluctantly clicks on the lin the email. A NEWS VIDEO CLIP opens. It shows HAND HELD FOOTAGE of A YOUNG, DEAD, AFRICAN MAN plain clothes lying in filth in an alley. He has been sho the back of the head. Blood pools around his shoulders.  10 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 6. The VOICE of a REPORTER plays over the footage, which cut various images of Al-Shabaab Militants chanting with weap raised, and graphics of the geographical area described.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Somali Al-Shabaab militants have posted this picture of an unnamed man they say they have executed in Nairobi. The group claims he was working for British military intelligence attempting to infiltrate their international recruitment networks. Al-Shabaab want to impose their strict version of Sharia law across the horn of Africa. They bitterly resent the role of Britain and the Kenyan military in propping up the UN backed Somali government in Mogadishu. The Ministry of Defense has declined to comment, but denounced the execution as “sickening.” Affected, but stoic, POWELL watches in icy silence. EXT. LAS VEGAS - NEVADA —- EVENING 9 FROM HIGH IN THE SKY we drift ominously over suburbs of tract homes that pattern the Nevada desert at last light. ON SCREEN: LAS VEGAS, NEVADA, USA - 20h44 INT. BEDROOM - STEVE’S HOUSE - LAS VEGAS - NIGHT 10 Dark. A large digital alarm clock reads: 20h44 A sleeping body is dimly visible with covers over its hea The clock clicks to 20h45 and the radio comes on: Indie r STEVE WATTS, 25, reluctantly moves the covers aside and f on a side lamp. He lies staring at the ceiling for a moment, listening to music, still half asleep, not wanting to get up just yet. The room is sparsely decorated. On his bedroom wall is a single, large framed aviation art painting by Randy Green “The Boys from Richmond” fighter jets against a striking  11 12 13 14 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 7. On a small desk is a framed picture of Steve graduating f University in Nevada, a plaque from a Reserve Officer Training Corps showing him commissioned as a 2nd Lieutena and an Undergraduate RPA (Remotely Piloted Aircraft) trai certificate. Finally there is a photo of Steve himself po in a flight suit next to a training aeroplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift over beautiful English countryside as dawn break

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, now in Wellington boots and a weatherproof jacket walks with Jesse. There is a weariness about her. A profo sadness lurking just beneath her tough exterior. She tosses a stick for her dog. There’s an edge of aggression, of unexpressed anger in the throw. Jesse chases it, happy. INT. BEDROOM - STEVE’S HOUSE - LAS VEGAS - NIGHT 13 (NOTE: This scene was formerly scene 21.) STEVE, slim and fit, listens to indie music as he runs a pace on a treadmill. INT. KITCHEN - POWELL’S HOUSE - SURREY - DAWN 14 POWELL walks in with Jesse. LIZZIE - a pretty late-teen girl wearing T-shirt and knic - looks inside the fridge. She reaches for a bottle of expensive bottled water. POWELL is not amused.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Lizzie.  15 16 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 8.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Some water.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Try the tap.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. Sorry. POWELL watches LIZZIE close the fridge door, go over to t sink, look for a glass, find a mug and fill it up.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Are you with Robert or Andrew?

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Robert. She walks toward the door - with her water.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Sorry. She walks out. INT. ALIA’S HOUSE - EASTLEIGH - NAIROBI - MORNING 15 ALIA has a well-used school mathematics book open in fron her and some spare paper. MUSA, is helping her with an exercise. She concentrates h Looks to him for approval as she completes a problem. MUSA MUSA (CONT’D) Good! See, not so difficult! Wanaagsan! Bal eeg, ma si adag! INT. KITCHEN - POWELL’S HOUSE - SURREY - DAWN 16 POWELL pours milk into a bowl of cereal at her kitchen ta claiming her space back. ROBERT, 19, walks in, lazy and bleary-eyed. He looks dishevelled and weedy in his boxer shorts.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Who is she?  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 9.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Um, her name’s Lizzie.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: I know her name. ROBERT casually goes to the fridge and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: She goes to St. Ada’s.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Does she. You should have asked me if she could stay.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Dad said she could. ROBERT takes a bottle of water out of the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: She’s already got water.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: She doesn’t like tap. ROBERT walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift over the magnificent high-rises of Singapore. ON SCREEN: SINGAPORE - 13h00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 18 A huge hall filled with a maze of stands showcasing MILIT HARDWARE: Missiles, machine guns, armored vehicles... IBS (Integrated Battlefield Solutions) operate on Stand B FOUR COMPANY MANNEQUINS demonstrate military clothing. On wears undergarments, the second fatigues and the third is full operational military body armour. JAMES WILLETT, British Foreign Secretary, pale and sweaty the heat, stands in front of the company name and slogan Soldier Safety First - as he speaks to a small audience gathered around the stand.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 10.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: On behalf of the British government, I am proud to introduce Integrated Battlefield Solutions, a UK company leading the field in the production of life-saving, lightweight military clothing. Protecting our soldiers in the field of battle is at the core of my government’s commitment to our armed forces. Soldier safety first is why we are in partnership. IBS director, NIGEL ADLER, beside him, nods vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And so I am very pleased to introduce you to IBS managing director, Mister Nigel Adler. A ripple of applause from the BRITISH REPS - but most of people watching are invited FOREIGN BUYERS and they wait silence for ADLER to speak. Also watching are KATE BARNES (25), PR to the Foreign Secretary, and TOM BELLAMY (28), his aide.

dialogues.speaker: ADLER
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, Foreign Secretary. We feel extremely honoured that you have taken time out of your hectic schedule to open our stand this afternoon. Thank you. JAMES smiles bravely - but he is struggling with what tur out to be food poisoning.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (a whisper to Tom) He’s going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I told him not to eat the prawns.

dialogues.speaker: ADLER
dialogues.text: Today we are introducing three new ranges: the Adamant Assault Body Armour System, the Personal Camouflage System and our light, fast-wicking underclothing range... JAMES is struggling to keep his insides under control.  19 20 21 22 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car drives away from a modest, secluded country home an heads off down a quiet tree-lined road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, tense, drives. Now wearing the military uniform o Army Colonel, she is on her car-mounted cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Simon, I will not have the boys bringing friends back for the night without asking me. (a beat) I’m not having it. (a beat) If they want to do all that, they can do it away from home. She's still so angry about it, she can’t finish the call:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s not right - and I’m not having it. That hasn’t calmed her down either. INT. LIVING ROOM / KITCHEN - STEVE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 21 (NOTE: This scene was formerly scene 13.) STEVE, showered and wrapped in a towel, enters an open-pl living room / kitchen area from a hallway. He crosses to a kitchen counter where A HOME COOKED MEAL simple plate has been covered and set aside for him. STEVE uncovers the food, looks at it for a moment, then places it into a micro-wave and presses a RE-HEAT button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We establish a low, modern building backlit by a pale sun SOLDIERS with ATTACK DOGS patrol a perimeter fence. POWELL drives in and parks in an “OFFICERS ONLY” lot.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: “PERMANENT JOINT HEADQUARTERS, LONDON”  23 24 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL comes out of a lift, walks along a windowless corr to a steel door, punches in a code and walks through. INT. ROOM —- PJHQ - MORNING 24 POWELL enters a windowless bunker where several military personnel work on computers. They come to attention as PO enters the room. Among them is SERGEANT MIKE GLEESON, 28, an OPS WATCHKEEP and SERGEANT MUSHTAQ SADDIQ, 27, a targeteer. They hold permanent positions here and so have a few pers mementoes beside their computers: baby photos, wives, children’s drawings. POWELL’S workspace is temporary - so there is nothing personal here. There are whiteboards with flip-charts and large TV scree suspended from the ceiling. On these screens are various high angled surveillance ima and graphics. We do not focus on any details yet. SERGEANT MUSHTAQ hands POWELL a report.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Morning Ma’am. Version 3 on Operation Egret is ready. Ahmed’s house data is included on Slide 3.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you. She looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only two Hellfires? Where are the GBU-12's?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Ma’am, given the mission brief we thought we should decrease the gross weight and increase the loiter time...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: So, I have just the two Hellfires?  25 26 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 13.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sergeant, next time, you clear it with me before you change the loadout, understand?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. POWELL drops the report back on Mushtaq’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A commercial airliner touches down in early light. ON SCREEN: NAIROBI, KENYA - 09h30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUHAMMAD ABDISALAAM (20), the clean-shaven American stude whose image we saw on POWELL’S office wall, comes out of Arrivals with a trekker’s rucksack. He seems on edge but smiles when he sees a Man, DRIVER ON holding a card with ‘Kenyan Student Exchange Services’ on

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER ONE
dialogues.text: How was the flight?

dialogues.speaker: MUHAMMAD
dialogues.text: (100% American accent) Yeah, it was good. Thank you. A CAMERA SHUTTER clicks and the IMAGE OF MUHAMMAD freezes a still frame on screen. A REVERSE ANGLE reveals an athletic looking Kenyan man, A ATIENO, 35, casually shooting a long lens, covert surveillance image of Muhammad from across the airport lo ATIENO lowers his camera and watches as MUHAMMAD is escor towards the airport exit by the DRIVER. He speaks into a small radio mike:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ATIENO
dialogues.text: Showman50, Bravo27: Sea Hawk has arrived...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 28 29 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A text pops up on SERGEANT GLEESON’S screen: “Showman50: Sea Hawk has left the airport."

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GLEESON
dialogues.text: Ma’‘am... Sea Hawk is in and traveling. POWELL looks up from signing paperwork at her desk that outlines Rules of Engagement etc. for the day’s mission.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Is the Reaper following? A WARRANT OFFICER at another desk responds:

dialogues.speaker: WARRANT OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’am. Patching us in. He works his keyboard and a A VIDEO IMAGE appears on a la TV screen at one end of the bunker... The image on screen is a HIGH ANGLED SHOT filmed by a REA DRONE flying unseen at 20,000 feet of an old SUV driving a main road bustling with hawkers and Matatu taxis.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Headed for Parklands? A YOUNG FEMALE CORPORAL at another station watches a scre that tracks the route of the SUV on a map of Nairobi.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FEMALE CORPORAL
dialogues.text: Looks that way, yes, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIRMAN 1st CLASS LUCY GALVEZ, tall, fit, Latino American, paddles a stand-up board toward towards a perfect beach. Across the bay we see a LARGE NAVAL DOCKYARD with WARSHIP starkly silhouetted against the setting sun. ON SCREEN: HICKAM AIR FORCE BASE, HAWAII 20h45  30 31 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 15. As LUCY steps off her board and onto the beach, three you American AIRMEN jog past her.

dialogues.speaker: AIRMAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Lucy, you coming to Jimmy’s tonight?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No. I’m on duty.

dialogues.speaker: AIRMAN
dialogues.text: Too bad!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Lucy lifts her board as the sun dips into the ocean. INT. ROOM - ALIA’S HOUSE - MORNING 30 ALIA is struggling with an equation. MUSA sits with her.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is too difficult, Papa! Xisaabta aad bay u adagtahay Aabe. (Hisaab-ta adbay oo adak ta hay aah be.) MUSA MUSA (CONT’D) Just do your best. Si fiican oo wanaagsan u Samey. (Siffee un o wanaksan, oo Samay.) FATIMA calls from outside.

dialogues.speaker: FATIMA FATIMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Customer! Macaamiisha! (Ma-a-mee-shaa! ) Immediately ALIA shuts her textbook - and HIDES IT under the seat cushion of a chair. Before he opens the door, MUSA looks back to make sure AL is not seen with the book. Then he exits and greets a mal customer (OMAR) waiting in the yard with a damaged bicycl The door swings closed on ALIA, leaving her sitting alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A street of middle income houses within walled compounds. The SUV with MUHAMMAD inside approaches one of the houses  32 33 34 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, from an angle at wall height (that may seem like a security camera POV) we PAN with the SUV as it drives thr the gates and pulls to a stop in front of a two storey ho SECURITY STAFF rapidly close the gates as the SUV door is opened for MUHAMMAD.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Welcome my friend, welcome! MUHAMMAD exits the car and is warmly greeted by the OWNER CUT TO - What looks like a SMALL TROPICAL BIRD perched hi on a wall of the compound. We push in on the bird and see that it is in fact A MICRO - a drone designed to look like a small bird, with a_smal glass lens embedded in its chest. This ‘bird’ is what has been filming the arrival of the S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one of the screens is the image from the micro-RPA bir the Owner escorting MUHAMMAD into his home.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: (into a headset) Hawaii5, North20, looks like we have Sea Hawk, but I’d like a positive ID.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE ANALYST
dialogues.text: (on another screen) Hawaii5, copy that. Running PID confirmation. On yet ANOTHER SCREEN is a much more high angled image of same action from a Reaper drone flying unseen at 20,000 f POWELL switches channels:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Showman50, North20. Good morning Moses - how are you this morning?  35 36 37 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR MOSES OWITI, Kenya National Intelligence Service (N has the image from the bird on his secure laptop.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Showman50, copy. Good morning Colonel! Very good!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Confirm Sea Hawk is in the blue zone but Condor is still in flight?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Sea Hawk is in the blue zone. We expect Condor to land in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you. Are your troops in place and ready to move in?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: (looks out at his troops) Yes. Briefed and ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a high-walled loading area are a number of military tr and FIFTY KENYAN SOLDIERS of Kenya’s elite D Company, dre for action, each with their weapon and gear beside them. Some smoke, some drink cans of soda, some quietly chat, others just sit and wait. It’s a strangely calm scene. INT. KITCHEN - MOM’S HOUSE - NIGHT 37 STEVE washes his dinner plate. He is now dressed in smart casuals. The front door opens and STEVE’S MOM, 45, wearing a waitr uniform, enters. She’s tired from a long shift.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom. Work okay?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: It was alright. Tips are better than Kansas. STEVE smiles.  38 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 18.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you like your dinner?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks, it was great. He picks up his car key.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You're off early? Thought your shift was much later?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m going to Sammy’s birthday.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh... They let you drink before...?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna drink. I’m just gonna stop by and say a quick happy birthday. He kisses her cheek and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Stevie... He turns back.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah? A beat. She’s obviously going through a tough time.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I won’t stay forever, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You stay as long as you want, Mom. He smiles briefly. She does too, grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE view establishing the imposing building of the British Ministry of Defence from the air. ON SCREEN: MINISTRY OF DEFENCE, LONDON 08h00

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (0.S)
dialogues.text: General. Good morning.  39 40 4l 42 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL FRANK BENSON (Deputy Chief of Defence Staff), in military service dress, is on his office phone

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: You got my email...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL is on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Yes, I did. Made me sick. His family will need our support.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Leave it with me. Do you have everything in place for today?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Good. I’1l be at COBRA in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: That should be fine. EXT. LAS VEGAS STRIP - NIGHT 4l We drift over bright night Las Vegas from a HIGH ANGLE. LAS VEGAS STRIP - 00h45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE walks into a glitzy club with loud music, flashing lights and pole dancers. The place is packed with people dreaming of and selling s It is the epitome of Vegas excess. STEVE crosses to A BAR. He reaches over the counter and g himself a MARTINI GLASS. A BARTENDER catches his eye and comes over.  43 44 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 20.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Just some water please - but throw in an olive and make it look alcoholic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES hurries down a trading aisle escorted by three BODYGUARDS as KATE and TOM struggle to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: The meeting with the Malaysian Trade Minister is now at four- thirty.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You’1l have to do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: But the...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Perhaps if you take an “Eezi Tum?”

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I need to go back to the hotel! He gets to his destination, the mens, and hurries inside. TOM and KATE stand with their coffees.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Why appoint a Foreign Secretary who always gets ill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE, with his “water only” Martini in hand, comes up so stairs and enters a private party area. He recognizes his birthday group, including SAMMY, 26. Th are all drunk. THREE DANCERS are entertaining the party.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Stevie!!! So good to see you! You got a drink?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I got one, Sammy. STEVE raises his fake Martini with the olive.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 21.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Man, I didn’t think you would come! He bear hugs STEVE.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: My best friend, man. My best - you know that right? STEVE stands smiling, trapped in SAMMY’s drunken embrace.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Right. I know. SAMMY releases STEVE from the hug.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Come on, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Sam, seriously, I can’t stay long. I’m on duty from three...

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: (imitating him) Steve, seriously, I'm on duty from six. Sit down. He turns to one of the DANCERS.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shelley! A lap-dance for my best friend!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No, no...

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Yes, yes... Over here, please! Over here... A DANCER, “SHELLEY,” approaches STEVE - and gently pushes backwards. Steve falls into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There ya go!!! him Despite the bravado there’s an edge of darkness to Sammy. if he has seen more in his 26 years than he’d ever let on  45 46 47 48 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 22. STEVE blushes as SHELLEY lowers her long hair over his fa INT. BAKERY - ALIA’S COMPOUND - MORNING 45 FATIMA looks in at the bread she’s baking in her wood-bur oven and removes hot loaves with a paddle. She sets the loaves on a table with others already baked.

dialogues.speaker: FATIMA
dialogues.text: Alia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA looks up from a travel book she is reading.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes, mama! Haa, Hooyo! (Haa Hoy-yo!)

dialogues.speaker: FATIMA, (0.S)
dialogues.text: The bread is ready! Rootiga waa diyaar! (Rooti-ka wad diyaar!) She closes her book and hides it under the cushion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A commercial flight touches down in midday heat. ON SCREEN: NAIROBI AIRPORT, KENYA - 11h45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RASHEED HAMUD (20) is the clean-shaven British student we in POWELL’S office. He carries a rucksack. He comes out of Arrivals looking anxious. He has instruct to act normally - not to look around him as if expecting something - but he’s so focused on doing the right thing he looks anything but normal. He’s relieved to see a driver (DRIVER TWO) holding up a placard with ‘Kenyan Student Exchange Services’ on it. He approaches DRIVER TWO and they shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: RASHEED
dialogues.text: (a south London accent) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: B48
dialogues.text: YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 23.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER TWO
dialogues.text: How was the flight?

dialogues.speaker: RASHEED
dialogues.text: It was okay, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER TWO
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: RASHEED
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you. Across the hall, AGENT ATIENO, unseen, watches Rasheed leaving with DRIVER TWO. Rasheed has his cell phone out a it looks like he is typing A TEXT MESSAGE. ATIENO talks quietly into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ATIENO
dialogues.text: Showman50, Bravo27: Condor has landed... He’s texting...

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Showman50, copy that. Proceed to the Blue Zone. OWITI leans forward and types a text message into his lap (NOTE: A surveillance image of the suburban house in Parklands is visible in another window on his screen.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A message from OWITI (Showman50) pops up on GLEESON’S SCR

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GLEESON
dialogues.text: Ma’am, Condor is texting.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Yes. And?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GLEESON
dialogues.text: It reads... Uh... “Hi sis, arrived safely. Give Mom a big hug for me.”

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: (dry as hell) How sweet...  49 50 51 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA, with a basket of her mother’s loaves, walks to a ta already set up on the sidewalk alongside a compound wall. She puts down her basket of bread, takes out a cloth and begins to carefully lay it on the rickety table. SHE HEARS RAISED VOICES - and looks up to see a POOR WOMA being questioned by THREE MILITIA MEN about her attire, w does not cover her wrists. MILITIA LEADER MILITIA LEADER (CONT’D) You need to cover yourself Waxaad u baahan tahay inaad properly! si sax ah naftaada dabooli! The MAN slaps at her exposed wrists with a short whip. MILITIA MAN #2 MILITIA MAN #2 (CONT’D) Go home! Now! Tag guriga, hadda! Humiliated the WOMAN walks away. The MEN look back and see ALIA glancing at them. TWO OTHE MILITIA MEN guarding a nearby compound watch her too. ALIA quickly lowers her gaze, afraid to be seen watching concentrates on laying out her bread on the table-cloth. EXT/INT. STEVE’S CAR - ROAD OUT OF VEGAS - NIGHT 50 It’s a beautiful, starry night. Music on the radio. STEVE drives a deserted road, headed into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENSON stares nervously at rows of toy dolls. He looks fo SHOP ASSISTANT - but she’s with another customer. He take out his phone. Punches a number. Leaves a message:

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Darling it’s your dad here. I’m looking at a whole shelf of these Annabell dolls. You didn’t tell me there are different types. I’ve no idea what to buy her. Can you get back to me asap? Otherwise... He picks up one of the dolls. Squints at the packaging.  52 53 54 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 25. LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON (CONT’D) I'm holding a... um... An Annabell Time To Sleep Doll and it says here ‘you will hear her babbling when it is beddy-byes'. Call me as soon as you can. He puts away his phone. Stressed, he stares at the doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STALL OWNER slops stew from a pot into take-away carton JAMA FARAH, a Kenyan of Somali origin, in his hat, jeans, shirt, glances about while he waits for his food. He eyes a PRETTY WOMAN in a tank-top and shorts crossing street. (This neighbourhood is not governed by Sharia law We may also notice a STREET VENDOR selling plastic BUCKET amidst dozens of other vendors. JAMA slaps hands with the STALL OWNER, pays him and heads down the street with three cartons of stew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA rounds a corner and approaches a battered commercial marked “Ruaka Engineering Services” parked on a quiet str He pulls open the passenger side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA enters the van with the food he has just bought. He hands a carton of stew to a DRIVER in the front seat and moves into the back of the van. Seated in the darkened interior, DAMISI, an indigenous Kikuyu Kenyan woman, also in jeans and T-shirt, sits in f of a secure laptop.

dialogues.speaker: DAMISI
dialogues.text: We've got Condor in the Blue Zone.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Who the fuck’s Condor? He looks over DAMISI’s shoulder at the computer screen.  55 56 57 58 59 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 26.

dialogues.speaker: DAMISI
dialogues.text: The second guy in from the airport. ON HER SCREEN: ANOTHER CAR is entering the compound. The OWNER opens the car door and RASHEED gets out. The image on DAMISI’S screen is from the micro-RPA bird w saw filming the arrival of MUHAMMAD earlier at the same house. DAMISI controls the filming using a mobile joystic device.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: I can’t keep up with these names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, seeing what DAMISI and JAMA are seeing displayed her screens, speaks into her headset:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Showman50, North20, can we get a view into the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI speaks into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’am. Peg90, Showman50, can you try and look into the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMISI and JAMA watch on the secure laptop.

dialogues.speaker: DAMISI
dialogues.text: Showman50, Peg90, moving now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see, perched on the compound wall, the micro-RPA bird. It takes off from its perch and flies around the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA and DAMISI look at the image from the bird flying ar the house on their screen.  60 61 62 63 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 27. They can’t get a view inside. All the shutters are shut.

dialogues.speaker: DAMISI
dialogues.text: Showman50 do you want us to bring in Ringo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI, continuing...

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Negative, not worth the risk yet. Wait for number 3 to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aerial view of London and the Cabinet Office building. ON SCREEN: BRITISH CABINET OFFICES, WHITEHALL - 11h15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENSON, carrying the doll he bought peeking out of a too- small plastic bag, speaks to a RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: General Benson. Here for COBRA. A young civil servant in a suit, JACK CLEARY, 30's approa from across the lobby, offering an outstretched hand.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: General Benson... Jack Cleary. I’m coordinating today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hallway off which we can see numerous rooms. A calm atmosphere as a few politicians chat. JACK is asking people to go into the Briefing Room. BENSON is on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute. Hold on a minute. He takes the doll from its bag.  64 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 28. LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON (CONT’D) Annabell Care for Me? What have I got? He sees that he has the Time To Sleep doll. LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON (CONT’D) Does it matter? I mean... We watch him as he listens: it plainly does matter. His AIDE-DE-CAMP appears by his side.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE-DE-CAMP
dialogues.text: General, they are asking for you.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: (sighing) All right, darling, I’ll try. Yes. Bye-bye. He shuts down his phone and looks at his AIDE-DE-CAMP anxiously. LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON (CONT’D) I bought a Time To Sleep doll when I should have bought a Care For Me. Apparently there is an important difference. He hands his AIDE-DE-CAMP the doll in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE-DE-CAMP
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do, sir. BENSON walks into the room. INT. BRIEFING ROOM A - WHITEHALL —- MORNING 64 COBR(A) - Cabinet Office Briefing Room A - is the Governm committee that meets in response to crises at home and elsewhere in the world that have implications at home. Eight VTC screens are at one end of the low-ceilinged roo and there are two more screens, one along each side. One of the screens has images from BBC News 24. Another h the live stream from the Reaper RPA, a third has images f the bird. There is a large conference table in the middle of the ro around which are leather chairs - but this is an ‘informa meeting to watch the attack on the house in Nairobi.  65 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 29. (Remind yourself of the image in the White House Situatio Room as they watched the attack on Bin Laden’s house.) A small group of politicians are gathered in the room alo with JACK CLEARY, the coordinating civil servant. BENSON shakes hands with GEORGE MATHERSON, Attorney Gener

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Good morning, Attorney General.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Morning, Frank. ON SCREEN - “GEORGE MATHERSON MP - UK Attorney General."

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Minister.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: General. ON SCREEN - “BRIAN WOODALE MP - Minister of State for For and Commonwealth Affairs.”

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Ma’am. Congratulations on your new appointment.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Thank you. ON SCREEN - “ANGELA NORTHMAN MP - Parliamentary Under- Secretary of State responsible for Africa." BENSON is at the head of the table. Already open in front him is a secure laptop computer from which he will be abl hold a text messaging conversation with POWELL. Beside th there is also a secure telephone.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: I am going to talk you through the capture of Susan Danford aka Ayesha Al-Hady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY GALVEZ, now in uniform and carrying a large takeout coffee, strides down a busy corridor of uniformed personn ON SCREEN: JOINT BASE PEARL HARBOR-HICKAM, HAWAII - 00h15  66 67 68 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY enters a cramped room with her coffee. An IMAGE ANALYST, bleary-eyed, sits in front of five scre On one is the live feed from the Reaper above the Parklan house. On another is the live feed from the bird.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE ANALYST
dialogues.text: Hi. Did you go to the party?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I was busy. You might still make it. What have we got here?

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE ANALYST
dialogues.text: We're tracking some extremists in Nairobi. One of them is from my home town.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: You're kidding, really? Her colleague brings up an image of MUHAMMAD ABDISALAAM o the screen as Lucy prepares to take over the shift.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE ANALYST
dialogues.text: Yeah. Muhammad Abdisalaam. Somali. We've got a lot of them there.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Well, let’s hope he’s not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve’s car crosses a desert runway, passing open hangars with fighter jets and Reaper drones visible within. He pulls up outside a small collection of low buildings. ON SCREEN: CREECH AIR FORCE BASE, NEVADA - 02h30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE zips into his flight suit in front of a locker. There are several RPA crews here, dressing for a new shif Most are so young it looks like a military training schoo  69 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 31.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Alright, listen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE, MATT (24) and CARRIE (22) listen to LT. COLONEL ED WALSH, a senior operations supervisor at Creech.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: I‘m going to introduce you to Colonel Powell in London. He presses a button on his desk console and COLONEL POWEL appears on a wall mounted Video Conference Screen. COLONEL WALSH (CONT’D) Good morning, Ma’am. Are we coming through clear?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Loud and clear, Colonel, thank you. It’s good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: And you, Ma’am. I have your crew ready. Introduce yourselves please.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Morning, Ma’am. Aircraft Commander Steve Watts. Pilot.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Airman First Class Carrie Gershon. Sensor Operator.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Senior Airman Matt Levery, Mission Intel Co-ordinator.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you. Today you will be flying a joint operation over Nairobi, Kenya. Code name: Operation Egret. As POWELL proceeds with the brief she clicks on relevant images that appear on a second screen in the room.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (showing a map) Horn of Africa. Somalia. Kenya. Nairobi. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 32.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have intelligence of a meeting of key members of Al-Shabaab in the suburb of Parklands - in this house here. Over a Reaper image of a house in the suburb of Parklands

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It belongs to a man named Shahid Ahmed, an Al-Shabaab facilitator. She puts up the image of Ahmed with Al-Shabaab leaders:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Due to visit the house is this man, Abdullah Al-Hady, a Somali... She puts up an image of Al-Hady.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .-. and his wife Ayesha Al-Hady, formerly Susan Helen Danford. She flips through images of Danford, some as a troubled t in the UK, the rest, intelligence pics of her as a jihadi

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: British national. Troubled childhood. Converted at fifteen. Radicalized in a west London mosque where she met and married Al-Hady. Intelligence has them connected to the most recent suicide bombing in Kenya. We see SHOCKING IMAGES of the carnage caused by a SUICIDE BOMBING in Kenya.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been tracking them for six years. Last seen in Addis Ababa two months ago. We see images of DANFORD and AL-HADY in Addis Ababa.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're numbers four and five on our East Africa Most Wanted List. We have information that they will be in Nairobi today, using the Parklands house as a transit point for two new recruits:  70 71 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 33. POWELL puts up an image of an American dressed boy: MUHAM ABDISALAAM, taken in a mall somewhere in the USA.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Muhammad Abdisalaam, American - the CIA have him connected to extremists in Minnesota. She puts up another image: RASHEED HAMUD at a protest in London with a charismatic ISLAMIC SPEAKER.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Rasheed Hamud, British. She puts up the image of the house again.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once all suspects are in the house, Kenyan special forces will launch a cordon and search. This is an operation to capture, not kill. You are tasked to be their eye in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE, relaxed, walk out into the night and he for what looks like one of a dozen beige shipping contain These are the Ground Control Stations (GCS) for RPA crews

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: So, Sir, how long have you been stationed here?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: About six months now. You?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I just got here.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay. How do you like Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: It can get a little wild. CARRIE and STEVE walk into the Ground Control Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE enter the narrow, windowless world. The previous shift are at their stations.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 34.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. Seen any giraffes?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Matter of fact, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Oh wow.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND CREWMAN
dialogues.text: A whole bunch of them ‘bout thirty miles east of the city.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CREWMAN
dialogues.text: The LR crew saw a whole herd of elephant on take off.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: No kidding?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Makes a change from staring at goats. The guys laugh. On one of the screens, we see the Parklan house and its neighbourhood. This image is fed from the M Reaper UAV flying 20,000 feet above Nairobi.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CREWMAN
dialogues.text: The aircraft is established in the orbit at Flight Level two zero zero, running covert. Aircraft and GCS are in the green with no write ups. He gets up and STEVE settles into the seat.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND CREWMAN
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) All cameras checked good. Here is the target... Ground forces are two streets away, in an old factory, over here. He pulls back on the throttle that controls the camera zo and the image snaps out to a wider area. He points out th location of the fifty soldiers of D Company concealed in their compound.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks. CARRIE settles into her seat.  72 73 74 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 35.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Weapons all spun up good. Ten hours time on station remaining. You still have two Hellfire missiles. Secure radio checked good. STEVE and CARRIE, now seated, look so young to be in cont

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (into radio) You guys strapped in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT and COLONEL WALSH wear headphones and watch the same images.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Comms good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA is still selling her bread. She only has a few loave left. A woman in a hijab approaches. WOMAN WOMAN (CONT’D) How much? Meega waaye? (Meh-ko why ye?)

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fifty shillings. Konton shilling. (Konton shill-ling.) WOMAN WOMAN (CONT’D) Forty? Afartan? (Affar-tan?)

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forty-five? Afartan iyo shan? (Affar-ton eeyo-shun? ) The deal is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE sit at the controls. On the screen in front of them, they watch A MAN COME OUT OF THE HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: We have movement.  75 76 77 78 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 36.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Zoom in. CARRIE zooms in as A SECOND MAN comes out of the house - but they are limited to an ‘above head’ shot and identification is not clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see in detail the big bank of screens. On one is the Reaper live feed. On another is the bird live feed. POWELL watches the live image from the bird of the two me exiting the house. It’s a wide shot, but the two look lik RASHEED and MUHAMMAD.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: (into headset) Hawaii5, North20, confirm PID.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Roger North20. I'd like to be closer. Lucy, speaking into a headset, is now settled in front of screens. Her colleague waves good-night from the door.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Peg90, go closer for PID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA watches DAMISI zoom the bird closer in. On their scr The two young men look tense. They are clearly Rasheed an MUHAMMAD. They turn as the Owner of the house comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches her screens like a predator: Rasheed and MUHAMMAD are talking to THE OWNER. He seems very grateful them for something - and to be wishing them well.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: North20, Hawaii5 confirms positive ID’s on Muhammad Abdisalaam and Rasheed Hamud.  79 80 81 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 37.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Roger that. She hasn’t taken her eyes off her suspects. Then she sees A DRIVER open the rear doors of the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it, they’re leaving. Where are Danford and Al-Hady?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GLEESON
dialogues.text: Ma’am, our intelligence only has them arriving in another half hour.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: (mot happy) Well then our intelligence is bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENSON looks at the screen, alarmed. The others, eating sandwiches and drinking tea and coffee see his reaction, uncertain what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI watches the live feed. He calls to his men:

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Load up! His men respond, hurrying to their trucks. Tension is hig OWITI talks to POWELL on his mike: MAJOR OWITI (CONT’D) North20, Showman50, I have my men ready. Do we go in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL hesitates, but only for a brief moment.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: No, hold your men. I want Danford and I’m hoping they will lead us to her. She's taking a calculated risk here and she feels it.  82 83 84 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI watches the same live feed.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Roger that. A tense CAPTAIN waits for the order to deploy his troops. MAJOR OWITI (CONT’D) Tell them to hold. Disappointed, the CAPTAIN reluctantly nods.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (changing channels) Bravo27, Showman50, follow if they leave. INT. AGENT ATIENO’S CAR - STREET - AFTERNOON 83 ATIENO, who we met at the airport taking covert photograp of Muhammad and Rasheed, hears the message on his earpiec

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ATIENO
dialogues.text: Bravo27, ready to follow. He starts up his engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch the live Reaper as the OWNER of th house hugs RASHEED with a long, affectionate embrace.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Looks like they know they’re not meeting again.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We don’t read into things.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Haven't we gotta think? RASHEED and MUHAMMAD get into the SUV with the DRIVER ONE

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over radio) Movers, say intentions.  85 86 87 88 89 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy in front of the screens:

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Stay on PAX.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Copy. SUDDENLY: A WOMAN in a long flowing dress, her head wrapp in a hijab, exits the house and gets quickly into the SUV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see this from the high shot of the Reaper. The bird is slow to catch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL is watching the image.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Who is that? Is that Danford?! I need a PID!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI is frustrated as he speaks into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Peg90 you missed her! Look in the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMISI and JAMA watch the image from the bird that shows side of the SUV - windows dark; just a shadowed outline o the woman in the back.

dialogues.speaker: DAMISI
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. Windows are tinted.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Damn it, is that her, or does Ahmed have a wife?!

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GLEESON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, we don’t know, Ma’am.  90 91 92 93 94 95 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 40.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Not good enough people! It has to be her. Why didn’t we know she was already in the house?! There’s an embarrassed silence. The image from the bird s the SUV move as the gates to the compound are opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch the Reaper feed as the SUV drives into the street. INT. AGENT ATIENO’S CAR - PARKLANDS STREET - AFTERNOON 91 AGENT ATIENO sees the SUV turn into another street and pu into traffic to follow it.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ATIENO
dialogues.text: Showman50, Bravo27, they’re heading east on route five... to Eastleigh. From his expression we sense that is not good news.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Damn it... Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the Reaper live feed of the SUV driving towards the Eastleigh Market Area.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Hawaii5, I want a PID on that woman as soon as we get a visual.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 94
dialogues.text: INT. ROOM —- HICKAM AIR FORCE BASE - NIGHT 95 LUCY, tense, in front of the screens.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’‘am.  96 97 98 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE pilots the Reaper to follow the SUV as it turns rig

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Zoom out. CARRIE pulls back the image. STEVE and CARRIE watch the Reaper image of AGENT ATIENO following the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL is alarmed as she watches the Reaper feed of the vehicles turning again. INTERCUT with OWITI checking a route on his secure laptop

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: North20, Showman50, it looks like they’re heading toward Eastleigh.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: That’s a no go area.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’am...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: How do we launch a ground assault if she’s going in there?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: We can’t... It would trigger a massacre.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: (to herself) Shit... (to Owiti) Alright, just stay with her. She watches the SUV slow down, turn into a side road and stop at AN AL-SHABAAB MILITIA CHECKPOINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENSON and the others watch the screen nervously.  99 100 101 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 42. INT. AGENT ATIENO’S CAR - EASTLEIGH - AFTERNOON 99 AGENT ATIENO slows and stops at an intersection. A left t will take him right into the militia controlled neighborh He can see the heavily guarded CHECKPOINT guarded by ARME MILITIA a short distance away.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ATIENO
dialogues.text: (tense) Showman50, Bravo27... do you want me to try and go in?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. Return to base. AGENT ATIENO, relieved, drives on.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Zoom in. CARRIE does. She and STEVE watch as a MILITIA LEADER - surrounded by a small posse - walks up to the SUV. The posse try to get a look at the people in the SUV. CARRIE and STEVE watch a respectful exchange between the militia leader and the Woman in the back passenger seat. all they can see from their high angle is her covered arm it extends out of the window. The arm waves as the SUV pulls away and drives into the militia controlled neighbourhood. STEVE and CARRIE follow the SUV as it turns into another street. The Militia seen driving around earlier with a machine gu bolted to the back of their pickup have parked on a corne Another fifty yards up the road, two armed guards with AK open the gates to a compound, and the SUV pulls in. There is another SUV already in the compound. The gates are immediately closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, watching the Reaper image.  102 103 104 105 106 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 43.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Showman50, do we know this house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI has the same Reaper image.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: (into his headset) It belongs to Amadu Mukhtar. He’s a Somali trader but there is no other intel on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the live feed as RASHEED, MUHAMMAD, the WO covered in the hijab and DRIVER ONE get out of the vehicl RASHEED, MUHAMMAD and the WOMAN walk into the house. The DRIVER stays outside.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Hawaii5, North20, did you see anything there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY analyses images frame grabbed from the Reaper video as the WOMAN walked into the house. Her eyes scan them rapidly. She zooms in. But the woman has kept her covered head down and LUCY can’t see anything helpful.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL reacts, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Showman50, we need an eye inside that house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI watches the Reaper image.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 44,

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Ma’am, that could risk the operation. We cut between the two:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: I have to know if Danford is inside and who is with her.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: It will mean putting a man on the street. He will have to be close to fly the beetle and he could easily raise suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Even if you use a Somali?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Al-Shabaab controls that neighbourhood. Every stranger is suspicious. Even a Somali. POWELL paces for a moment. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Major, we both believe we have Danford in that house, do we not?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’am...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: And I cannot authorize a strike without a Positive ID...

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: I understand that...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Then I believe we need to accept the risk and send someone in. Can you do it?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’‘am.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you. I appreciate what you are doing.  107 108 109 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWITI draws a breath and talks quietly into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: (to JAMA) Peg90, Showman50, I need you to engage Ringo at the target house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA, seated with DAMISI, looks shocked for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Showman50, Peg90, you want me to enter the militia controlled area?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: Yes... We need a positive ID. A beat. JAMA looks nervously at DAMISI. Then summons his courage.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Showman50, Peg90... leaving now. DAMISI looks at him, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: DAMISI
dialogues.text: What if you are recognised? JAMA just looks at her. The question lingers.

dialogues.speaker: DAMISI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You better have a good story for where you’ve been this last year. EXT. AMADU’S COMPOUND - EASTLEIGH - AFTERNOON 109 ALIA walks past Amadu’s compound and turns into the passageway leading to her own house. EXT. ALIA’S COMPOUND - EASTLEIGH - AFTERNOON 110 MUSA is talking to OMAR:

dialogues.speaker: OMAR
dialogues.text: Since the boys have taken over, nobody is stealing any more. MUSA can’t risk saying anything

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s a good thing. 12 September 2014 46.

dialogues.speaker: OMAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tan ilaa iyo wiilashii wax Xadaayey in badan uu san wiil danbe wax Xadeyn. (Tan illa-yo weel-la-shee wah haadaayay, in badan oo san will dambe wah hadeen.) other than agreeing with him.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haa waa fikrad aadiyo aad u fiican. (Haa wafikrad aa-diyo aad oo fee aan.) ALIA walks into the compound. OMAR looks up and sees her.

dialogues.speaker: OMAR
dialogues.text: Now you can leave your door open and no one will steal your bikes.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: OMAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hadda Al-baab kaaga oo furan waad dhaafi kartaa ma jiro qof baaskiil kaaga xadayo. (Haad-dah Al Baab kaaga afuran waad dhaafi kaarta majjeero kof baaskeel kaagah haa da yo.)

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haye. (Haa ye.) ALIA drops her empty basket in the bakery. OMAR reaches into his pocket and pays MUSA. ALIA exits the bakery and picks up her hula hoop. As OMAR is exiting the gate with his repaired bicycle, she starts swinging it on her hips. OMAR glances back disapprovingly at ALIA, forcing MUSA to immediately admonish her.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: Alia! What are you doing? ALIA immediately stops.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: Sorry, papa.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: What were you thinking of?

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Al-liya, Maxaad Sameyneysaa? (Al-liya mahad samen-ney-sa?)

dialogues.speaker: ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Igi Raali nogo Aabe. (Igraali nokko Aah-be.)

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maxaad ka Fikreysaa? (Mahad ka fik-ray-saa?)

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: I don’t know papa. 12 September 2014 47.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ma Agaano Aabe. (Ma Akaano Aah be.) She stands still, awaiting more punishment.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: Never again!

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: Yes papa.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mardan be yaan arkin adigo fikraaya! (Mardum bear yaan arkeen adeego fik raa ya!)

dialogues.speaker: ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haye Aabe. (Haa yay Aah be.) OMAR smiles insincerely and wheels away his bicycle. As the gate swings closed behind him, MUSA turns to ALIA.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: You must learn to be more careful.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: I don’t know whether he supports the militia or if he is just pretending to because he thinks I do - but we take no chances. We trust no one. And you never ever do that in front of a man.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: No, papa.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waa inaad si fiican wax u barataa iskuna badnaataa. (Wa innad siffee un wah u barataa iskoo nah budnaa tah.)

dialogues.speaker: ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haye. (Haa yay.)

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aniga Ma agaano mana taageerayo maleeshiyada iyo Haddey si Qalden ila hadlaan ama ila dhagmaan laakin waxaan qaadanaya fursad. Mana Aminayo qof walbo, adiganah weligaaga. Mardanbe, haku ciyaarin nin hortiisa ama dadka ii imaanaya hortooda. (Aneega ma akaano mannah taa- ge-rey-yo militia-dah iyoh hadday si qualdan illah hadlaan ama illah dhak-maan laakin wah-haan gqadah-nayah foor sud. Ma amee-ney-yo qoof walbo, adee-gana welli gaa gaa maar-dum-bay haako-i-ya- rin neen hortisa amaah daddkaa i imaan-ney-ya hor- toodah. )

dialogues.speaker: ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maya Aabe. (May ya Aah-be.)

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: Never again, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: Yes, papa - but I can do it in front of you? 12 September 2014 48.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marnaba ha isku deyin haye dheh? (Mar-nabbah-haa-is-koo day in haa yay dheh?)

dialogues.speaker: ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haye Aabe, laakin adiga hortooda waan ku ciyaari karaa soo maahan? (Haa yay Aah bay, laakin adeegah hortoodah waan ku iyaaree karaa so mahaan?) A beat. MUSA puts his arms around her and hugs her close.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: MUSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haa, waad ku ciyaari kortaa horteyda. (Haa, wad koo ee yaa ree kartaa hortoodah. ) ALIA picks up her hoop again and starts to swing her hips The hula hoop soon whizzes around her body. MUSA smiles. ALIA has the rhythm going - faster and more expressive - whole body and soul determined to be free. Her defiance is exhilarating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA'S VAN pulls up beside a STREET VENDOR selling stacks coloured plastic buckets.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: STREET VENDOR
dialogues.text: One eighty each.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: One thousand five hundred. For all of them.

dialogues.speaker: STREET VENDOR
dialogues.text: (eyes popping) Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Meego waaye? (Merko why yay?) STREET VENDOR (CONT’D) Halka xabo waa sided shilling. (Halka haabo wa deed shill- ling.)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kun iyo shan bogol dhamaantooda. (Koon ee-yo-shan bokoll dam- maan-toodah. ) STREET VENDOR (CONT’D) Haye Mudane! (Haai yay Moo dan-nay!)  112 113 114 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 49,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reaper image hovers over Amadu’s house. 112 We now see that Alia’s compound borders this house - and the corner of the image, we make out ALIA twirling her ho MUSA watches her as he repairs a bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Look at that little girl. A long beat as he and CARRIE look. CARRIE tightens on ALI bit, without losing the house next door.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Isn’t she great.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, she’s beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Makes me smile. EXT. ALIA’S COMPOUND - AFTERNOON ALIA twirls and twirls her hula hoop with a passion. INT. ROOM —- HICKAM AIR FORCE BASE - NIGHT LUCY watches as ALIA twirls her hoop. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: EXT. ALIA’S COMPOUND - AFTERNOON ALIA twirls and twirls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the image from the Reaper too. Then talks her mike. 113 114  120

dialogues.speaker: A120
dialogues.text: 121 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 50.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Showman50, how long before you have your man in the area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers are still on stand-by as MAJOR OWITI talks.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: He’s on his way, Ma’am. I can also get agents into positions outside the militia controlled area to cover as many exits as possible in case they leave.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Good. Do that. Thank you. POWELL is also, for a few moments, distracted by ALIA. EXT. ALIA’S COMPOUND - AFTERNOON A120 FATIMA looks out from inside her house.

dialogues.speaker: FATIMA
dialogues.text: Tea’s ready. Come! ALIA drops her hoop and heads into her house with her fat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA walks across the street towards the MILITIA MEN at t entrance to the militia controlled area of Eastleigh. He looks convincing as a poor trader selling buckets - bu one MILITIA MAN has an idea to check him out. MILITIA MAN MILITIA MAN (CONT’D) Hey, show me. Waryaa iTusi. (War ya e too see.) JAMA walks over to him. The MILITIA MAN checks that the buckets aren’t concealing anything. MILITIA MAN MILITIA MAN (CONT’D) What are you hiding? Maxaa qarineysaa Adiga? (Maha qar nay sah aa-dika?) JAMA JAMA (CONT'D) Maya Hiding? Nothing sir. waxbo ma Qarinaayo? (Maa ya wah bo maqara-nay- yo?) The man RAISES HIS WEAPON and points it at Jama. Jama, tenses and backs up slightly.  122

dialogues.speaker: MILITIA MAN
dialogues.text: Give me one. Jama frowns, confused.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: What? A bucket?

dialogues.speaker: MILITIA MAN
dialogues.text: You have anything else? 12 September 2014 51. MILITIA MAN (CONT’D) Isii hal xabo. (Ee see hal habo.)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waa maxay? Baaldi? MILITIA MAN (CONT’D) Ma leedahay wax kale? Jama swallows briefly. Does the man want a bribe? Afraid man may search him he speaks very politely.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Please sir, if I give you one, all my profit will be lost. Please sir.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waa ku baryaa mudane. Hadaan hal xabo ku siiyo. Faa'iido ma helayo. Waa ku baryaa ii dhaaf. (Waa koo bar-yah moo-dan-ne. Had-dhaan hal-habo koo seeyoh. Faa-ee-doh meh hee-la- yoh. Waa koo bar-ee-ah ee- daff.) A tense beat. Then the MILITIA MAN smiles as if Jama has passed some test.

dialogues.speaker: MILITIA MAN
dialogues.text: I'm joking, fool. Go! Go! MILITIA MAN (CONT’D) Waxaan kaftan, dogon. Bax! Bax! Jama draws a relieved breath, smiles politely and moves quickly through the checkpoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA walks towards Amadu’s compound. He stops at a distance. With a narrow view of the house, he is far enou away to avoid the suspicion of the armed guards. He puts down his buckets and sits on one of them. Then he surreptitiously takes a small box out of his pock and opens it. In the box is a live ‘AFRICAN FLOWER’ BEETLE. JAMA places it gently on one of his overturned buckets.  123 124 125 126 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 52. EXT. AMADU’S COMPOUND - AFTERNOON 123 The beetle flies into Amadu’s compound. It searches the outside of the house and eventually finds an opening in a back door. It hovers, looking in.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We are in. Transmitting now. POWELL watches a second screen flicker as an image from t Beetle sputters to life: Through a crack in the back door we see: INT. KITCHEN - AMADU’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON 125 AMADU has his back to us. He is carefully placing seven d onto a small intricately patterned plate. He places the plate onto a silver tray, which already has small ornate glasses of “zam zam” (holy water) on it. He doesn’t see the beetle hovering just outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA controls the beetle. Watching the image on his cell- phone, he notices a BOY, KHALID, 12, staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: KHALID KHALID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that a game? Game miyaad ciyaareysaa? (Game mee-yad ay-yaar-ay-— sah?) JAMA JAMA (CONT’D) Yes. Haa. (Hah.)

dialogues.speaker: KHALID KHALID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which one? Noocee waaye? (No-ay why-yeh? ) JAMA JAMA (CONT’D) Nothing for a boy. Ma' ahan midki ciyaalka. (Ma-ahaan mid-key ee-yal- kah.)

dialogues.speaker: KHALID
dialogues.text: A shooting game?

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Do you want a job?

dialogues.speaker: KHALID
dialogues.text: Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Stay here and sell my buckets. I will give you half my money.

dialogues.speaker: KHALID
dialogues.text: One half?

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: One half.

dialogues.speaker: KHALID
dialogues.text: Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Ask one fifty for each bucket - but you can take one twenty.

dialogues.speaker: KHALID
dialogues.text: Yes sir! Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: And don’t talk to me, I am busy.

dialogues.speaker: KHALID
dialogues.text: Yes sir! 12 September 2014 53.

dialogues.speaker: KHALID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Makula ciyaaraa? (Ma-koo-la ee-ya-rah?)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fiiri shago ma Rabtaa. (Fee-ree shak-koh ma rub-— tah.)

dialogues.speaker: KHALID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haa Mudane! (Haa Moo-dan-ay!)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Inta Joog iiGad_Alaabteyda waxaan ku sinayaa haaf lacagtayda. (Inter joog ee-gut alab-tay- dah wa- haan koo sinayah half la-ak-tay-dah. )

dialogues.speaker: KHALID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hal haafaa? (Hal haa-fa?)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haa, hal haaf. (Haa, hal half.)

dialogues.speaker: KHALID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haye, mudane! (Haa-yeah Moo-da-nee!)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Do I have permission, Minister? They again all turn to WOODALE. He sweats:

dialogues.text: Well, given the situation - that it is a change of mission - that it is now a missile attack on a British subject - in fact two British subjects, and an American, and ina friendly country - I think it is right and proper for me to refer up to the Foreign Secretary. BENSON can’t believe WOODALE is passing the buck.  167 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 73.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: (annoyed) With respect, Minister, you have heard the arguments and he hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: (interrupting, annoyed) No, the point is, I have not been a party to previous discussions with the PM on such matters and the Foreign Secretary will have been! So... I do have a duty to refer the matter to him.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: What am I telling Colonel Powell?

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: Tell her to wait. A beat. BENSON types a text into his laptop.

dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’‘am. MUSHTAQ uses his computer to put up an image of Amadu’s h and compound on another of the large screens. Concentric ‘collateral damage’ circles are superimposed on the image He uses a laser pointer on his diagram of the layout of t house and compound:  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 74. MUSHTAQ (CONT’D) If the men stay in this room - and this here is the target area - we would expect a one hundred per cent mortality rate in the room, an eighty-five to ninety-five per cent mortality rate within this area and anything outside the building - this area here in the street - a sixty-five to seventy-five per cent rate. That is just the Hellfire. If we factor in the explosives in the vests... We are looking at even more extensive damage - way out to this area here - but I can’t accurately estimate that payload.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: But we would be containing that payload in the vests within those walls, right? Far less collateral damage than them going off ina crowded shopping mall.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Yes... Of course.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you. Obvious to anyone not trying to avoid making a decision. MUSHTAQ watches POWELL walk back to her station - not entirely comfortable with her fixation on using the missi
