dialogues.text: Thank you, Major. POWELL watches the Reaper screen as JAMA approaches ALIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA walks along the street with his few remaining bucket towards ALIA. He is anxious but tries not to show it. The ARMED GUARDS are suspicious of everyone and everythin and so the way they are eyeing up JAMA is not unusual. JAMA approaches ALIA. JAMA JAMA (CONT’D) How much? Meeko waaye? (Meek-oh why-yay? )

dialogues.speaker: ALIA ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fifty. Konton. (Konton.) JAMA JAMA (CONT’D) Give me all of them. Isii ayaga dhamaantooda. (Iss-see ay-yay-gah dum-maan- too-dah. )

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: All of them?

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Yes. All.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kuliggoodaa? (Koo-lee-goo-dah? )

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haa. Dhamaan keen. (Hah. Dum-maan ken.) As JAMA gets out the money, another armed guard - ABDI - comes out of the compound. JAMA gives the money to ALIA and scoops up the bread.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI
dialogues.text: Hey? JAMA flinches, but doesn’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! I know you. Waryaa waan ku garanayaa! Jama backs up slightly.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Yes, I used to live here.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing here now?

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: I am a trader now. Selling buckets. 12 September 2014 92.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haa, Waan ku noolaan jiray inta.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Halkaan Maxaad Ka Sameyneysaa?

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waxaan Ahay hadda ganacsade iib geeya baakadaha. ALIA, slightly nervous, starts to put away her tablecloth

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: I have come back my friend!

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I asked where you have been!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: I went back to Somalia. My mother was ill...

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Xaggeed Ku Maqneed?

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waxaan usoo laabtay saaxibadeyda.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waxaan ku weediyay xagee baad ku maqneed!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waxaan dib ugu laabtay somaliya hooyadeyda ayaa xanuun-saneed...  218 219

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no, I remember, you tried to dance with my sister... You took her into the city. I remember... You have no honor!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: I don’t dance anymore...

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We chased you out! (to his friends) Hey, this guy likes the Kenyans! 12 September 2014 93.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maya, maya , waan xusuusta, waxaad isku deyi jirtay inaad la ciyaarto walaasheyda waxaad u kaxeen jirtay magaalada waan xasuustaa ma lihid wax wanaag ah oo aad isku dayday!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hadda Ma Ciyaari Wax Badan

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waan ku daba socday ! (to his friends) Waryaada gofkaan wuu ka helaa kenyaanka ! Alia listens, confused and a little tense.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the others) Search him. Jama starts to back up.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do it now! ABDI’s weapon is raised.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Gah-mah-hah kor oo tag.) Qabta ninka. (Cub tah ninka.)

dialogues.speaker: ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hadda sameeey ! Two militia GUARDS approach to search him. JAMA THROWS the bread and buckets at them and RUNS. He dashes for an alley between houses. ABDI and the two other GUARDS give chase. ALIA pulls back, frightened for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE and STEVE watch JAMA as he runs away.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Fuck! Instinctively CARRIE pans the Reaper’s Camera with JAMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 219 JAMA runs. ABDI, in pursuit, fires a round after him. A BULLET barely misses JAMA as he clears a wall.

dialogues.speaker: A221
dialogues.text: YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 94, He lands in a yard where A BARKING DOG lunges at him - bu comes up short on a chain that tethers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches with despair as JAMA runs for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA scrambles over a fence and dashes through A COMPOUND An OWNER yells at JAMA as he scrambles over a car and disappears round a corner.

dialogues.speaker: OWNNER OWNER
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell are you Hey! Maxaa ka cadaabta u doing?! samaynaysaan?! ABDI drops into the yard and points his gun at the OWNER.

dialogues.speaker: ABDI ABDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where did he go?!!! Xagee buu qaaday?!!! Frightened, the OWNER waves vaguely in the direction JAMA took.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head down, JAMA walks quickly across a street near a Mosq trying to look like he belongs in the area. He ducks into an alley behind the Mosque. He runs down the alley, rounds A CORNER, vaults another w and - LANDS BADLY on a pile of building rubble: His leg buckles as his ankle twists horribly. In real pain he sees nowhere to hide. He pushes through clothes lines, hobbles to another fence drags himself over into - AN ABANDONED LOT — Across the lot, he sees a place he can hide beneath A PIL RUSTED METAL SHEETING - and he crawls under it. He lies still, breathing heavily, eyes wide.  222 223 224 225 226 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 95. Not far away, out in the alley, he can still hear ABDI shouting and asking people where he went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, watching the Reaper feed, sees ABDI and two other MILITIA MEN arguing on a street not far from where JAMA h hidden. But for now Jama is safe.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Get me back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE seems momentarily frozen at her controls, frighten as she and STEVE watch the armed militia shout and point different directions close to where JAMA is hiding.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Carrie, forget him. Get back to the target.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Carrie... CARRIE snaps out of her reverie. She leaves the injured J and brings the image back to the outside of Amadu’s house ALIA is picking up the loaves JAMA dropped in the street. She dusts them off and takes them back to her stall.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Jesus, she’s going to sell them again... CARRIE looks at STEVE. He’s pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA cleans the dust off the bread with the tablecloth an starts laying the loaves back out on the table.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENSON and the others grimly watch the Reaper feed of ALI On the Beetle screen, RASHEED exits the bathroom. ABADE ushers him back into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the Beetle feed as RASHEED returns to the bedroom and sits back on the bed. On the Reaper feed, Alia is again trying to sell her brea

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: (small voice) Who else can we get to buy the bread?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Forget the bread, Sergeant. We will be lucky if our man hasn't blown the whole operation. (to Harold) Harold, where are we legally?

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: With the girl?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Yes! Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Again, I would refer up...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: No, I am asking you! We cannot hold up this operation any longer.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: We need to take all reasonable steps to minimize collateral damage. If we’re buying her bread...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: We're not! It’s over. Dozens of civilian lives are at risk. Children's lives are at risk. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 229 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 97.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This girl is just one. Are we clear to engage? Yes or no! Make a decision!

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: With respect, Ma’am, I don’t make these decisions. I advise you on the law. And the law is not here to get in your way. It is here to protect you and your target...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Don’t lecture me, Harold!

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Ma’am, the legal questions of necessity and proportionality are almost certainly met. But for the protection of you, and of that child, I would refer up to the Attorney General. That’s my advice.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Bloody hell... On her Reaper Screen: Alia sells her bread. Unknown to he ABDI appears in the yard and begins an animated discussio with a GUARD. After a while, the GUARD enters the house. On the Beetle feed she sees RASHEED arms clasped across h chest, while ABADE moves MUHAMMAD into a kneeling positio front of the video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENSON and the others are also watching the Reaper feed o ALIA and the Beetle feed of Muhammad making his recording

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: Jesus, they’re making a video... BENSON’S SECURE PHONE RINGS. He answers. Listens briefly. Lowers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: (to George) Mission Command has a question on the legality of continuing the operation whilst this girl remains at the scene... Connect us, Jack. JACK activates a screen and POWELL appears on it.  230 231 232 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 98.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sir, our lawyer says the girl’s presence has not necessarily altered the legitimacy of our operation, but he needs that confirmed. POWELL is still keeping an eye on all her screens.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Do we have an assessment of what might happen to her?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: The targeteer assesses a 65 to 75 percent chance of fatal injury should we proceed. But he has also assessed a projected loss of life of between thirty and eighty men, women and children if the vests are detonated in an urban area. It’s a guess of course. But we should assume they intend to target a crowded location. No one knows quite what to say. On the Beetle screen, ABA recording of Muhammad's suicide video continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE wait anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We’re going up the kill chain again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA waits for customers behind her table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch Alia. 230 231 232

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 233 234 235 236 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 99,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the Beetle feed: MUHAMMAD still making his video but is suddenly interrupted by DANFORD saying somet to ABADE and gesturing for him to come outside. ABADE, no happy, seems to tell AL-HADY to continue the recording. On the Reaper screen, Alia is still trying to sell her br while in the yard of the compound behind her, ABADE appea and begins an animated debate with ABDI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch as A WOMAN walks up to ALIA.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Come on, just buy the bread. They watch as the WOMAN puts one loaf into her bag. There now seven loaves on Alia’s table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the Reaper feed as ALIA and the WOMAN talk The Woman walks away from ALIA. On the Beetle feed, Muhammad finishes his suicide recordi and stands looking lost, waiting for ABADE to return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA is on one screen. On the Beetle feed RASHEED and MUHAMMAD wait for ABADE...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: A sixty-five to seventy-five per cent fatality assessment - it could be argued - requires us to do whatever we can to enable her to be removed from the scene.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: We have done what we can for her in the time available to us.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: There is no law covering a situation quite like this. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 100.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is one thing to release a missile doing everything in one’s power to minimise collateral damage: In other words to release a missile whilst the street is clear, but in the hope that it will remain so... It is quite another thing to release a missile knowing that this girl will, at worst, be fatally injured and, at best, severely injured. So, I disagree with the assessment of your lawyer at Northwood.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Agreed...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I would be uneasy if we did not at least consider the option of delaying and giving her every chance to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE stares at ALIA. She is haunting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA’S presence is haunting this room too, disturbing everyone, whatever their point of view. WOODALE continues to sweat through his indecision. COLONEL POWELL is on a screen.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sir, if we wait and they leave, we will no longer have control of the situation. Nairobi is a busy, crowded city. We must strike now. The room is silent for a moment. BENSON fills the silence

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: It is generally understood that it is sometimes necessary to sacrifice the one in order to save the many.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: If the one is not oneself.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 101.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Secretary, this is an ethical argument we cannot get into at this moment.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Colonel, perhaps you should address that comment to the little girl selling her bread! The ethical argument is precisely what we must “get into.”

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Ma’am, I hope the fact that she is a sweet “little girl” is not clouding your judgement. Dozens of other “little girls” lives are at stake if these men leave. Before Angela can respond, JACK’S laptop bleeps.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to the room) I’m sorry, a Ms. Jillian Goldman from the White House is asking to be patched through.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Who?!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Jillian Goldman...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: She's the senior legal adviser on the US National Security Council.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She's been briefed by the Secretary of State.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: (without enthusiasm) Put her on. GOLDMAN’s face comes up on the VIC screen. Her image is o the screen next to the image of ALIA and her bread stall.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDMAN
dialogues.text: Good afternoon and thank you for allowing me to comment.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: Thank you for joining us.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 102.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDMAN
dialogues.text: Our point of view here at the White House is that we should attack this target immediately. As the military members of your committee know, we have a points system that takes into account collateral damage to deduce what is, and what is not, a legal strike. And let me tell you, categorically, that the existence of this new circumstance does not push us beyond a legitimate military action. We are way off what we would consider a dispute in this matter.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ms. Goldman, we have a somewhat different approach to the question of collateral damage...

dialogues.speaker: GOLDMAN
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Sir, you must act NOW. You have two men about to embark on a suicide mission; you have number two, four and five on the President’s East Africa kill list in your sights - and you are putting the whole operation at risk because of one collateral damage issue?! I realize this mission is your call, but there will be some mighty angry people here in the White House, and at the Pentagon, and out there in the world, if you allow these people to leave and blow a shopping mall to kingdom come.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, we have the Foreign Secretary wanting to join.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: Right... We appreciate your thoughts, Ms. Goldman. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. GOLDMAN is cut from the screen.  239 240 241 242 243 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA stands beside her bread stall waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE anxiously watch ALIA on the live feed. In the AMADU’S yard they see the TWO GUARDS who chased JA with ABDI return. The GUARDS shrug and appear to be telli ABDI and ABADE that they cannot find JAMA. INT. ROOM —- HICKAM AIR FORCE BASE - NIGHT 241 LUCY also watches ALIA on the live feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES, drained of all colour and in his pyjamas and dress gown, sits watching his laptop. TOM and KATE are behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES comes up on the screen vacated by Goldman.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, everybody. Excuse my appearance, it’s night here and I have a bout of food poisoning...

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: (brushing it aside) We're very sorry to drag you off your sick bed...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That’s quite all right.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: «+. but thank you for joining us.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: George, do I understand this correctly: that there is a legal argument for waiting and giving this girl an opportunity to sell her bread?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 104.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes there is, but, conversely, it does not mean that there is not also a legal argument for releasing the weapon now.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Forgive me, I’m not sure that helps me.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (awkward) James, given the developing situation... there is a very persuasive argument that the decision to act now could be construed as legitimate.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Is that “Yes”? GEORGE hesitates. Tense, BENSON steps in:

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Foreign Secretary, there is a military necessity for acting now. In our view they will be making a move from the house at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, what action is being legally recommended to me?! GEORGE sweats. WOODALE steps in:

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: James, the legal argument is that we could wait but that we need not wait. The military argument is that we should not wait.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES sweats on a decision, watching the live feed of ALI front of him on his computer.  245 246 247 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches the screen image of JAMES as he stares d at his own computer. Beside the image of JAMES is the Rea image of ALIA and her loaves of bread. In the compound yard, ABADE turns back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES stares at the Reaper image of ALIA, frozen by his inability to act as her executioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENSON and the others watch JAMES. WOODALE looks at ALIA. His face is drained of color. He d a breath. He has finally made a most difficult decision. On the Beetle screen, ABADE, frustrated, re-enters the bedroom. He moves RASHEED into a kneeling position on the floor and pulls the suicide vest over his head.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: (to James, with real empathy ) James... My recommendation is that we do not delay in proceeding with this mission. JAMES still hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sir, if we do not act now we risk losing the lives of up to eighty people. Many will be children.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: With respect, you can only assume those deaths - but what is certain is that, if we do act now, this one girl will suffer.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: And would you save her and risk killing eighty others?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Yes. I would save her and take that risk. That is what I would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 106.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Angela, is it you or me who will be invited on to the Today programme to explain why we knew of the attack on a mall that killed eighty people but chose to do nothing to stop it?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (quietly, respectfully) You, James... But frankly... politically... I’d rather point to Al-Shabaab as murderers of eighty people shopping than have to defend a drone attack by our forces that kills an innocent child. A beat. Everyone is wrestling with the dilemma. GEORGE sh awkwardly, perhaps persuaded by Angela’s new argument.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: James, Angela makes a compelling point. If Al-Shabaab kill eighty people, we win the propaganda war. If we kill one girl, they do.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: So we don’t do it? A beat. Unlike WOODALE and Angela, GEORGE, ever the lawye just won’t commit to a decision.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She’s got another customer. They all look at the screen and see that A WOMAN is buyin two of the loaves. There are now five left.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: I suggest you keep your eye on the other screen. The beetle sees that RASHEED’S vest is slowly and careful being wired with explosives by ABADE. LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON (CONT’D) With respect, Foreign Secretary, are the lives of eighty people, including innocent children, really worth the price of winning the propaganda war?  248 249 250 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 107. JAMES, caught in a terrible dilemma, stares at the screen watching as ABADE and AL-HADY wire RASHEED. The painstaki process will take time, but it is chilling to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA sits by her bread stall, waiting. A mangy dog comes to the stall and sniffs the bread. ALIA talks to the dog - and the dog eventually wanders of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is haunted by ALIA - and doesn’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: General, if we go ahead... might footage of our attack be leaked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at James on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Sir, the footage from the Reaper is completely secure.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But we’ve seen it happen before. There are many people involved in this operation. It will surely be recorded on many computers.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Foreign Secretary, I assure you...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (interrupting) General, I would feel uncomfortable if we did not at least wait a little longer. BENSON bites his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we go ahead... and footage is leaked... and this girl is... killed as a result... Then... I think the country would be most disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 251 252 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 108.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Foreign Secretary, it is our task to make the right military decision. We cannot engage in an argument about possible future postings on You Tube.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: With respect, General, revolutions are fuelled by postings on You Tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES stares at ALIA, tormented by her image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room watches and waits, becoming increasingly impatie with James’ indecision. He can’t make himself ‘condemn’ t girl - and so he looks up to the camera and says:

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I think the consequences are such that we need clearance from the PM. Just about everybody in the room wilts at another decisio maker passing the buck.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: Foreign Secretary, you have the authority to make a decision without returning to the PM. BENSON looks hard at WOODALE: ‘And so do you.’

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No, I am telling you that you need to take it to him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sir, the PM is making a speech in Strasbourg this afternoon and may not be easily interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I will leave you to sort that one out, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes, sir... I’11 track him down.  253 254 255 256 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 109. JAMES cuts his camera and disappears from the screen. Jack leaves the room in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES, is now off camera at COBRA, but he can still see a hear everyone in the conference room on his laptop screen He is horrified at the situation, and at his own lack of ability to decide, as he stares at ALIA in another window on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: For God's sake. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ma’am, what is happening?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: You are on stand by, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch ALIA.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) It’s still in the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT and COLONEL WALSH.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What the fuck are these guys doing in the chain anyway?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: Hey, keep it together, alright? MATT is really on edge. COLONEL WALSH (CONT’D) Alright?!

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Yes, sir...  257 258 259 260 261 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOMAN buys three loaves from ALIA and walks away. INT. GROUND CONTROL STATION - NIGHT STEVE looks at ALIA and her table.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Two loaves left.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: We've gotta wait now.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the feed from the beetle - ABADE is progressing well with the wiring of RASHEED’s vest - And then: THE SCREEN FLICKERS - AND DIES.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: What’s happened to the feed?!

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GLEESON
dialogues.text: Checking, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI has the same dead screen.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: North20, Showman50... The battery has died.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Ma’am. It’s a very small battery...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Christ... She has lost control of the situation. 110. 257 258 259 260 261  262 263 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 111. She stares hopelessly at the dead screen. And then at the Reaper image of the exterior of the house: Nothing is happening outside. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irritation is replacing tension in the room.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Battery...

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: For God’s sake, now we have no idea when they might leave the house. POWELL talks discreetly, away from the room.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: I might have a solution. If my targeteer can calculate us coming in under fifty per cent for the collateral damage on the girl then do you think we will get approval at your end? A beat. BENSON can only speak with others listening.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Yes. I do. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL puts down the phone. She looks at ALIA on the scre She feels a sickening personal relationship with her now because she is in a position to manipulate her fate. A beat, then she walks over to MUSHTAQ who is at his stat She bends down to have a quiet word with him.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: We are looking to present the collateral damage in the street, in this area here, as forty-five to fifty per cent fatality. MUSHTAQ tenses up.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 112.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: I've calculated a sixty-five to seventy-five...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: If we can put the payload here or here, if we can still guarantee target fatality but reduce the collateral... A tense pause.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perhaps we can target the missile here... or here...

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’‘am.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Do whatever you can to save this girl's life.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: --. Yes, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE anxiously watch the image from the Reape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting continues.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: If we have to announce to the people of Nairobi that we knew everything but we did nothing...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We do not have to announce that we knew anything, General. Let’s wait to hear from the PM. BENSON is shocked at George cutting him short. JACK comes in.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 113.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The PM asks that we do what we can to minimise casualties.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Bloody coward...

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: Is that all he said?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: How would you interpret that, George?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Minister, we cannot have military decisions dictated by government committees! Nor can we put on hold a military operation at every stage for legal clarification. You tell us when to go to war, we conduct the war and you deal with the aftermath.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: (ice cold) If only it were that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL stands over MUSHTAQ as MUSHTAQ shows her his new calculation with concentric circles over the target area.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Adjusting the target to here... there is a forty-five to sixty- five percent possibility of fatality.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sixty-five?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: I need that calculation to be below fifty per cent.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 114. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Well I...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Perhaps there is an adjustment in the assessment on the impact here?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: That calculation is already at the lowest limit of what I believe is possible.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Or if you target the missile here?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: I would still have to make that a sixty-five per cent possibility on the upper limit.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: I need you to make this work, Sergeant. A beat. MUSHTAQ looks cornered.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Yes Ma’am. MUSHTAQ is sweating at what he is being asked to do.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: We are locked into this kill chain and a decision has to be made. There are many lives at stake.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Ma‘am... I think... I think that if the target is here then... then I could, I think, predict a forty- five per cent possibility of fatality. That might be possible.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Forty-five per cent?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Possibly. Yes.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 115.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: I will put that to Cobra.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Ma’am, it’s...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: It is my understanding that, in these circumstances, your calculation can only be speculation. That puts you beyond any culpability.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sergeant. POWELL goes back to her desk. Looks at ALIA on the screen She knows that she will be her executioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL appears on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sir, I have a revised assessment from the targeteer. A diagram appears on one of the other screens.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you look at the diagram... By targeting the missile here, there is an estimated forty-five per cent chance of collateral fatality in this area here, where the girl is positioned. Suddenly everyone can see the get-out.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have now done everything in our power to give this girl a chance to survive.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Thank you Colonel. (to Woodale) Minister, do we have authority to prosecute the target?  268 269 270 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 116. Everyone now looks to him.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: Forty five percent?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Yes. Minister, you recommended earlier that we do not delay in proceeding with this mission. With a lower CDE there is surely now no need to consult the PM. Or the Foreign Secretary. May we proceed? WOODALE is skewered.

dialogues.speaker: WOODALE
dialogues.text: ~-. Yes. BENSON picks up the secure phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES, watching WOODALE and the group on his screen, cove his mouth with his hand. Though he now appears to be off hook legally, he is horrified by what is about to unfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL on the secure telephone.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You may proceed.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. She puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE and STEVE watch ALIA.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (a whisper, a prayer) If we can hold a few more moments and allow the grace of God - perhaps the grace of God - to intervene.  271 272 273 274 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 117.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (tense) Talking like my mom.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I know. Mine too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL picks up the telephone to Mission Control.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, we have re-run the CDE. You are authorised to prosecute the target. Engage now. Am I clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE watches ALIA with her two loaves of bread.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (a long beat) Yes, Colonel. (to Carrie) Cleared to engage. An unbearable beat before he restarts the process to enga

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Running the ‘dash thirty four’ checklist. Carrie, call when ready. Carrie can’t believe the order, but now she must obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA emerges from his hiding spot. He takes off his jacke and hides it in rubble so he is less recognizable. His twisted ankle is causing him great pain. He hobbles t broken metal sheeting fence and looks through a gap into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy, ALI, 10, is playing with a ball. Trying to look casual, JAMA steps bravely into the alley and calls to Al

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Hey, boy, what’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: Ali, sir.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Ali, I want you to buy me some bread. The girl selling it is on the corner of 147th and Parker, near the market. It is special bread - so only buy it from her. You must buy all of it. He gives ALI some money.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: This is plenty of money. Bring it to me here. If you come back in five minutes, I will give you another two hundred shillings. Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: Go like the wind! 12 September 2014 118.

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waryaa yarii soo magacaa? (War-yah yaa-ree soo mah-gah- ah?)

dialogues.speaker: ALI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cali, Mudane. (Ali, moo-dan- ay-)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cali, waxaan rabaa inaad iisoo gado rooti. Waxaad iiha soo gadaa gabadha gees kaas ku gadha wadada 147 and Parker. Waa rooti fiican iyada keliya iiga soo gad. Waa inaad kasoo gadaa kuli. (Ali, wah-haan rub-baa i-naad ee-so gah-dah roo-tee. Wah- haad eega so gah-dah gah-bah- dah gees kaas koo gah-doh wah- dah-dah 147 and Parker. Wah roo-tee fee-un ee-yah-dah keh- lee-yah eager so gut. Wah i- naad kah-so gah-dah koo-lee.)

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tani waa lacag badan. Iigu keen inta iyo ku so lawaato. Shan dagiiqo gudaheed waxaan ku siinayaa. Labo bogol shillin. (Tah-nee wah lah-ak bah-dan. Ee-goo ken in-tah ee-yo hah- daad koo so lah-wah-too. Shan dah-kee-goh good-dah-hed wah- haan koo see-nay-yah. Lab-tah bok-kol shilling.)

dialogues.speaker: ALI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haye, mudane! (Hi-yay moo-dah-nay! )

dialogues.speaker: JAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Waxaad usoo oradaa sidaa queeleystaha oo kale! (Wah-haad oo-so orad-dah see- dah qool-lay-stah-hah o-ka- lay!) ALI runs off with the money JAMA has given him.  275 276 277 278 279 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 119.

dialogues.speaker: ALI ALI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes sir! Haye, mudane! (Hah-yay moo-dan-ay! ) JAMA keenly watches him run around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR OWITI’s phone rings. He answers. Cut between:

dialogues.speaker: JAMA
dialogues.text: (on his cell phone) I have sent a boy to buy the bread. He will be there in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE, now sweating profusely, continues to prepare the firing of the missile. He is being professional - but he cannot stop his emotion coming through. Every so often he breaks off to glance at - but only for second - the image of ALIA on the screen. He keeps his fo but is collapsing inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL is looking at the live Reaper feed.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR OWITI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We have sent in a boy to buy the bread.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: We've been up and down the chain enough, Moses. We’re not taking any more delays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALI runs down the road, weaving in and out of traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches the live Reaper feed on the screen.  280 281 282 283 284 285 286 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 120. Nothing is happening - just ALIA at her table and the occasional passerby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON ALIA - by her table, whispering, trying to recal what she has learnt from her book earlier in the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE continue their preparations to fire. The pressure of ALIA not selling her last loaves is unbearabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALI now turns off the street and runs down a passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PASSERBY comes over to ALIA and talks to her. We watch him as he walks on. ALIA looks up and down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE pulls back the image to see if there is traffic - cyclists, pedestrians, motorists - approaching. Two pedestrians walk towards the compound. STEVE keeps his eye on ALIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA watches the TWO PEDESTRIANS approaching. She is hopi they will buy her last two loaves.  287 288 289 290 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further down the street, ALI emerges from an alley and ru towards Amadu’s compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the screen.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: When they pass the house, we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE watches tensely as the pedestrians approach the sta and walk past it. ALIA now stands alone on the street. There’s a long pause STEVE knows he has to release the missile - but he can’t it. Perhaps he is also waiting for that miracle, an angel the grace of God, anything... But he is getting no help. He knows he is alone. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Three... Two... One. He presses the button.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rifle! Rifle! Rifle! Weapon away. Time of flight, fifty seconds. For fifty long seconds:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE waits, watching ALIA and the house and the compound ALI comes into view, running down the street.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: There’s a boy! STEVE is too stunned to comment, as he glances at ALI and then fixes back on ALIA.  291 292 293 294 295 296 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, MUSHTAQ and HAROLD watch the screen.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: He’s buying the bread... She looks at her stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch ALI arrive at the bread stall.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He’s buying that bread! Come on! ALI buys the last two loaves, gives ALIA the money, runs

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put the money away! Put the fucking money away! A beat.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck! Put the money away! Come on! Put the money away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA takes her time to count her money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, MUSHTAQ and HAROLD watch in tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES, ashen, KATE and TOM watch on James’ laptop. INT. ROOM —- HICKAM AIR FORCE BASE - NIGHT 296 LucY, leaning forward, anxiously watches ALIA on the scre  297 298 299 300 301 302 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA folds her money. Then carefully puts it in her pocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE wait as they watch ALIA. She is now carefully folding her tablecloth.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds. (with quiet dread) Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA’s in no hurry as she neatly continues to fold her cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL again looks at her stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Nine seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch ALIA as she finishes her folding. STEVE watches her pick up the basket. Soundless, the missile goes through the roof of the house All we can see on the Reaper live feed is a dust cloud, obscuring everything around the compound.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND -
dialogues.text: ALI looks back in horror as secondary explosions from the suicide vests rip the house apart. IN ALIA’S COMPOUND -—  303 304 305 306 307 308 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 124. FATIMA and MUSA react as the house next door detonates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches, waiting for the dust to settle and the picture to become clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES looks like he will throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE stares at the smoke and dust where ALIA was standin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alia’s table has been blown thirty yards away. She has been blown over by the force of the blast. She is bleeding and has internal injuries. She doesn’t know what has happened or what is going on. S has entered another world: she knows nothing but an insti to try and move away. She gets up to move but her body - her legs - won’t prope her, they just won’t go with her. She keeps trying to crawl forward - but no part of her bo is actually able to achieve it so she rocks forwards and backwards, going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust cloud clears. STEVE can see ALIA. He can see tha she is moving. He stares, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL grimly watches the same image.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sky45, North20. Zoom in for BDA when able. We need to know that we have hit our targets.  309 310 311 312 313 314 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE look at the image from their live feed.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Going in. The camera pushes in on the ruins of the house and ALIA g out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY is already analysing the Reaper imaging of the strik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL and MUSHTAQ see what looks like a woman in another part of the house, crawling away.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Is that a body?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: It’s moving...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Sky45, close in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA still tries to move herself away - but the strength draining from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE look at the image from their live feed a closes in on the remains of AL-HADY, ABADE and AMADU. RASHEED and MUHAMMAD, who were wearing the vests, have be blown to bits and are not identifiable. It tightens in on DANFORD, who is in another part of the building crawling away, unable to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY works fast, watching the live image of DANFORD from Reaper and matching it to a pattern-of-life image of her.  315 316

dialogues.speaker: A316
dialogues.text: 317 318 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 126.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Suspect crawling away identified with high probability as Susan Helen Danford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, HAROLD and MUSHTAQ watch the image from the Reape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA has stopped trying to crawl to safety. She is runnin out of strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, HAROLD, MUSHTAQ, their eyes still fixed on the im

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Re-engage target. HAROLD flashes her a look...

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Colonel...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) We're going again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE briefly looks at ALIA on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Target the moving body. STEVE and CARRIE take a deep breath. They have fallen int their own hell.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Re-engaging target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA is alone. Fading away.  319 320 321 322 323 324 325 326 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA hobbles round a corner and looks down the street to where the explosion took place. He can see the dying ALIA He stares in horror as people push past him to see what h happened in their neighbourhood - curious, afraid, shocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE go through the same routine as they prep to fire again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY takes a moment off analysing the pictures to try and recover from having to watch ALIA fighting for her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL, grim, as she looks at the image of ALIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches ALIA, a small helpless figure on the scr She moves slightly. No one is capable of taking their eyes off the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE pulls the trigger and releases the second missile.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Rifle! Weapon away. Fifty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA alone. Several long seconds. Then we hear an anguished cry.  327 328 329 330 331 332 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 128.

dialogues.speaker: ALIA
dialogues.text: ALIA strains to turn and sees: Her mother and father running towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE are shocked as they see MUSA and FATIMA coming into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches the scene play out on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA lies in the street. MUSA and FATIMA run towards her. Boom! The second missile explodes in the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same dust cloud obscures the view of the compound - a again STEVE and CARRIE have to wait to see anything. As the dust clears, they see Musa and Fatima lying flat o the ground in the street. Musa struggles up, covered in blood. Fatima rises too. He one arm hangs limply, bloodily by her side. STEVE watches ALIA: she is not moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches. MUSHTAQ and HAROLD watch. No-one in the r moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIA lies on the ground. Now we see that she is still ali  333 334 335 336 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 129. She looks up - and sees MUSA and FATIMA stumbling toward MUSA comes to ALIA. He picks her up. No one else is comin near the scene. MUSA and FATIMA stagger away from the bombed house with A It’s a terrible image as they stagger down the street. Someone reverses a pickup truck towards them. It’s the on saw earlier with the YOUNG MILITIA MEN and the machine gu bolted onto the back. The MILITIA MEN jump down to help MUSA and FATIMA put ALI into the back. They rapidly dismount the machine gun and toss it to anot man on the street to make room in the back. The DRIVER gets back into his cabin and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL watches as the pickup truck drives out of the imag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE watch the screen in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES, doubled over with stomach ache, and in shock - wit KATE and TOM watching from behind him - stares at the Rea image on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMA watches helplessly as the pickup truck roars past hi He looks around him. No-one is paying attention to him no Everyone is focused on the site of the missile attack. Devastated, he stares blankly back at the destroyed house shocked neighbours begin to gather in the street.  337 338 339 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are with MUSA and FATIMA cradling ALIA as they are dri fast down the road. They race towards the checkpoint. Sho Militia move aside as the vehicle speeds through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all still staring at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL looks at the live feed. She’s grimly realistic tha she has done what had to be done. She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, are you okay? We cut between them: STEVE answers on the phone. He is not okay. And neither is CARRIE.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yes Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: You have done your job well.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: We have eliminated three high value targets. A beat. STEVE is silent.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And we have saved a lot of lives.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’‘am. STEVE is desolate. CARRIE is pale and in shock. POWELL hesitates a moment longer. Then hangs up the phone She notices MUSHTAQ sitting in silence, just looking at h  340 341 342 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 131.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Sergeant, I couldn’t see any other option.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma’am. I understand that. But MUSHTAQ doesn’t understand it. POWELL’S military intelligence career has been reduced to lying about percentages in order to complete her mission. MUSHTAQ stares at her, numb.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: You will file your report as a 45 percent CDE. Silence from MUSHTAQ.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sergeant? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ
dialogues.text: 45 percent. Yes, Colonel. POWELL can’t hold MUSHTAQ’S look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSA cradles ALIA in his arms in the back of the pickup a speeds its way - horn blaring - through the streets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLONEL WALSH is looking at the Reaper image. It’s just sitting still.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: Steve you need to get us close in on the remains of Danford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE and CARRIE glance at each other. In stunned silence, CARRIE starts to zoom in as STEVE pil the Reaper slowly back over the destroyed house and they in on the scattered parts of a dead body in the rubble.  343 344 345 346 347 348 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 132.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY, unsettled, but still professional, matches the imag the dead body parts, of the clothing, to the image of Sus Danford taken when she was alive earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE and STEVE both stare silently, numbly at the scree They see the chatroom message: “Based on the footage I am seeing, body confirmed as Susan Helen Danford."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL picks up the secure telephone.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: (quietly, sombre) Mission accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Good job. Well done, Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL POWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time we see the MQ-9 Reaper UAV. It is 20,0 feet up in the sky. We see Nairobi far, far below. The Reaper turns around and heads back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting is over. GEORGE and BRIAN leave quietly, brie awkwardly, shaking Benson’s hand. As the room empties, ANGELA looks across the table as BEN begins packing his things.  349 350 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 133.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: In my opinion, that was disgraceful. And all done from the safety of your chair.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: I have attended the immediate aftermath of five suicide bombings. On the ground. With the bodies. What you witnessed today, with your coffee and biscuits, is terrible. What these men would have done would have been even more terrible. That is how it is. (almost killing her with the line) Never tell a soldier that he does not know the cost of war. He takes his briefcase and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BENSON exits the room, his AIDE-DE-CAMP hands him the Annabell Time To Care doll. He is momentarily confused, t manages a half smile.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT-GENERAL BENSON
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain. He takes the doll and walks away down the quiet hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSA, carrying ALIA, and FATIMA - in bloody clothes and w bloodied faces - alarm everyone as they burst through doo into a busy hospital corridor. Moving down the corridor, they shout for attendance. A NURSE rushes forward. Seeing the extent of Alia’s injuries, she rushes them int rudimentary operating theater. MUSA lays ALIA onto an operating table. A DOCTOR approaches quickly and takes a look at her. But it doesn’t take him long to realize that ALIA is dead He looks at FATIMA and MUSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 351 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 134. An agonising silence. And it slowly dawns on them that th have lost her. CLOSE ON ALIA - lying there, very still. And then MUSA lets out the grieving roar of an animal tha echoes into the next scene -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS across a vast, empty desert, and finds the isolated airforce base shimmering in early morning heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A METAL DOOR is shoved open hard. STEVE and CARRIE step o into the blazing sun and blinding light of the Nevada des They stop as they see COLONEL WALSH standing alone in the harsh light a short distance away, silently waiting for t STEVE holds a canned drink. His hand shakes. Adrenalin ha kept him going. Now he is drained. A mental wreck. CARRIE looks confused. Can’t process what has just happen WALSH eyes them both, then tries awkwardly to offer comfo

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: You did well. Both of you. They stand in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Will you let me know what happened to the girl?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: I will find out.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I need to know that.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: I know you do.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Text me or something.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: I’1l do that.  352 353 354 YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 135.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Silence again. Then -

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL WALSH
dialogues.text: We should get you home... I need you back here in twelve hours. STEVE and CARRIE stare at COLONEL WALSH blankly. Lost. EXT. ALIA’S COMPOUND - EASTLEIGH - DAWN (FLASHBACK) 352 ALIA, laughing, swinging her hips, her hula hoop whizzing around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON POWELL, as if she is seeing the image of ALIA, driving in silence for a while, lost in thought. Then she snaps out of her reverie and taps the screen on car's inboard computer. She selects ‘check messages’.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: You have one unheard message... Her husband's voice comes on.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Katherine, I want you to know that I don’t appreciate your angry calls first thing in the morning. Neither do the boys want to be humiliated in front of their girlfriends. Robert is under a lot of stress with his exams so you back off. This is just about the last thing she wants to hear. As s drives on, she is as tense as she was in the morning. We pre-lap the rising SOUND of an angry crowd... EXT. AMADU’S COMPOUND - EASTLEIGH - DUSK 354 A large crowd has gathered in the street outside the bomb house. Placards denouncing America and Britain are waved. Weapons brandished. Some of them set fire to a United Nations flag - and angr wave the burning emblem.  YELLOW SHOOTING SCRIPT 12 September 2014 136. Camera rises up, slowly leaving the crowd below. As we rise higher, clouds slowly move in, until the view below disappears completely and we -
